title: Emergency First Aid Basics
summary: Essential first aid techniques for common emergencies including CPR, wound care, and shock treatment.
content: Learn life-saving first aid techniques: Check for responsiveness, call 911, control bleeding with direct pressure, treat for shock by elevating legs, and perform CPR if trained.

title: Evacuation Procedures and Routes
summary: How to safely evacuate during emergencies, including route planning and what to bring.
content: Know your evacuation routes, keep emergency supplies ready, stay calm, follow official instructions, and have a family meeting point.

title: Water Purification and Storage
summary: Methods to purify and store water safely during emergencies.
content: Boil water for 1 minute, use water purification tablets, store 1 gallon per person per day, and keep containers clean.

title: Emergency Food Supplies
summary: Essential food storage and preparation for emergency situations.
content: Store at least 3 days of non-perishable food per person. Include canned goods, dried foods, energy bars, and manual can openers.

title: Earthquake Safety Procedures
summary: What to do before, during, and after an earthquake to stay safe.
content: Drop, Cover, and Hold On during shaking. Get under a sturdy table, protect your head, and stay away from windows and heavy objects.

title: Fire Emergency Response
summary: How to respond to fires and prevent fire emergencies.
content: Call 911 immediately, evacuate quickly and safely, stay low under smoke, feel doors before opening, and have escape routes planned.

title: Severe Weather Preparedness
summary: Preparing for and responding to severe weather events like tornadoes and hurricanes.
content: Monitor weather alerts, have a emergency kit ready, know safe rooms in your building, and avoid windows during storms.

title: Emergency Communication Plan
summary: How to stay connected with family and authorities during emergencies.
content: Keep phones charged, have backup power sources, designate out-of-area contact person, and know local emergency frequencies.

title: Power Outage Response
summary: Staying safe and comfortable during extended power outages.
content: Use flashlights instead of candles, keep refrigerator closed, use generators outdoors only, and conserve phone battery.

title: Emergency Shelter Setup
summary: Creating temporary shelter and staying warm during emergencies.
content: Find or create windproof shelter, insulate from ground, conserve body heat, and signal for rescue if needed.
